comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
JONES, HARRY
Rank:Lieutenant
Date of Death:15/05/1918
Age:42
Regiment/Service:London Regiment (Royal Fusiliers) 4th Bn. 
Awards:Mentioned in Despatches
Grave Reference AG. 371.Cemetery ALDERSHOT MILITARY CEMETERY

Additional Information:
Son of Walter and Mary Jones, of Hastings, Sussex; husband of Frances Amy Jones, of 528, Alexandra Park Rd., Wood Green, London.

At the time of the 1911 census Harry and his wife lived at 69 Clarence Road, Wood Green, London. They had been married for ten years and had two young children: Ronald Austen (2) and Muriel White (1 month). Harry was an Elementary School Teacher.

comment.author: 32921850@N00
comment._content: A handsome, almost sculptured face. Killed accidentally. What a waste.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Private Harry Jones of 28th (City of London) Battalion of the London Regiment, The Artists Rifles was Commissioned as a Second Lieutenant in 4th Battalion The London Regiment (Royal Fusiliers) on 2nd July 1915 [LG of 2nd July 1915].  On the same day a Lance Serjeant (Monkman), and 3 other Private soldiers, (Leake, Johnstone, and Walmisley), all from The Artists Rifles, were also Commissioned into the 4th Battalion of the LONDONS.//
